name: remote-fortisoar
label: Remote FortiSOAR
description: This connector facilitates automated interactions, with a FortiSOAR endpoint using FortiSOAR playbooks. Add the Remote FortiSOAR connector as a step in FortiSOAR playbooks and run REST API operations on FortiSOAR environments other than your own FortiSOAR environment

fields.title: FortiSOAR Endpoint URL
fields.description: Specify the URL of the FortiSOAR server to which you will connect and perform automated operations
fields.tooltip: Specify the URL of the FortiSOAR server to which you will connect and perform automated operations
fields.name: url

fields.title: Authentication Type
fields.name: auth_type
fields.description: Select the type of authentication that will be used to connect and communicate with the remote FortiSOAR server. You can choose between Basic (default), HMAC or API-Key
fields.tooltip: Select the type of authentication that will be used to connect and communicate with the remote FortiSOAR server. You can choose between Basic (default), HMAC or API-Key

Basic.title: User Name
Basic.description: Specify the username to access the remote FortiSOAR server to which you will connect and perform automated operations
Basic.tooltip: Specify the username to access the remote FortiSOAR server to which you will connect and perform automated operations
Basic.name: username

Basic.title: Password
Basic.description: Specify the password to access the remote FortiSOAR server to which you will connect and perform automated operations
Basic.tooltip: Specify the password to access the remote FortiSOAR server to which you will connect and perform automated operations
Basic.name: password

API-Key.title: API Key
API-Key.description: Specify API Key to access the remote FortiSOAR server to which you will connect and perform automated operations
API-Key.tooltip: Specify API Key to access the remote FortiSOAR server to which you will connect and perform automated operations
API-Key.name: apikey

HMAC.title: Public Key
HMAC.description: Specify the public key that is used to access the remote FortiSOAR server to which you will connect and perform automated operations
HMAC.tooltip: Specify the public key that is used to access the remote FortiSOAR server to which you will connect and perform automated operations
HMAC.name: public_key

HMAC.title: Private Key
HMAC.description: Specify the private key that is used to access the remote FortiSOAR server to which you will connect and perform automated operations
HMAC.tooltip: Specify the private key that is used to access the remote FortiSOAR server to which you will connect and perform automated operations
HMAC.name: private_key

fields.title: Verify SSL
fields.description: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not. Defaults to False.
fields.tooltip: Specifies whether the SSL certificate for the server is to be verified or not. Defaults to False.
fields.name: verify_ssl

operations.title: Make an API call
operations.description: Makes an API call to the FortiSOAR remote endpoint using the specified method and payload
operations.tooltip: Makes an API call to the FortiSOAR remote endpoint using the specified method and payload

parameters.title: Endpoint IRI
parameters.description: Specify the IRI of FortiSOAR-supported RESTful APIs endpoints using which you want to make the API call to the remote FortiSOAR server. For example /api/3/alerts
parameters.tooltip: Specify the IRI of FortiSOAR-supported RESTful APIs endpoints using which you want to make the API call to the remote FortiSOAR server. For example /api/3/alerts
parameters.name: iri

parameters.title: HTTP method
parameters.name: method
parameters.description: Select the HTTP method using which you want to make the API call to the remote FortiSOAR server. You can choose from the following commonly-used HTTP method: POST, GET, PUT, and DELETE. These HTTP methods correspond to create, read, update, and delete (or CRUD) operations, respectively
parameters.tooltip: Select the HTTP method using which you want to make the API call to the remote FortiSOAR server. You can choose from the following commonly-used HTTP method: POST, GET, PUT, and DELETE. These HTTP methods correspond to create, read, update, and delete (or CRUD) operations, respectively

GET.title: Query params
GET.name: params
GET.description: Specify the API Query parameters using which you want to make the API call to the remote FortiSOAR server. API Query parameters can be defined as the optional key-value pairs that appear after the question mark in the URL. Basically, they are extensions of the URL that are utilized to help determine specific content or action based on the data being delivered
GET.tooltip: Specify the API Query parameters using which you want to make the API call to the remote FortiSOAR server. API Query parameters can be defined as the optional key-value pairs that appear after the question mark in the URL. Basically, they are extensions of the URL that are utilized to help determine specific content or action based on the data being delivered

GET.title: Headers
GET.name: headers
GET.description: Specify the Header associated with the API call you want to make to the remote FortiSOAR server. HTTP Headers are an important part of the API request and response as they represent the metadata associated with the API request and response
GET.tooltip: Specify the Header associated with the API call you want to make to the remote FortiSOAR server. HTTP Headers are an important part of the API request and response as they represent the metadata associated with the API request and response

operations.title: Upload file to FortiSOAR
operations.description: Makes a file upload request based on the provided attachment/file IRI

parameters.title: Attachment/File IRI
parameters.name: file_iri
parameters.description: Specify the Attachment/File IRI of the file to upload.
parameters.tooltip: Specify the Attachment/File IRI of the file to upload.

parameters.title: Create Remote FortiSOAR Attachment
parameters.name: create_attachment
parameters.tooltip: Select this option, i.e., set it to True to create attachment of the file in remote FortiSOAR. Clear this option, i.e., set it to False (default) to create file only.
parameters.description: Select this option, i.e., set it to True to create attachment of the file in remote FortiSOAR. Clear this option, i.e., set it to False (default) to create file only.
